answers.text:
Bruce, there are two possible options that come to mind. First, you could utilize the ICMA Job Center,   http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/job_seekers/browse_jobs  . If you look under the employer tab there are instructions about how to post an ad. Secondly, you could reach out to the California League of Cities. This organization posts jobs in its monthly publication. I am sure you could contact them and ask about the process for posting a position. Hope this is helps!

author: Bruce Delgado
text:
Can an interim or permanent city manager position be advertised nation wide or state wide or region wide with only $10K or less spent to get the word out and still expect to attract 3-7 good candidates?
What outlets or venues are common for advertising California city manager openings?
title: most cost efficient manner to advertise intereim city manager job
